intro: Tontelea ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf tontelea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest. Tontelea ovalifolia is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
